title: Everything it covers
author: NeverTrulySet
summary:
A quiet night, a company of friend, and a shared embrace.

(Set between the end of chapter 26 and the beginning of chapter 27 of Tuyo, before they go off to confront Lorellan.)

title: Just a few fruit
author: oldernowiser
summary: Following the events of Tuyo, Ryo and Aras have been travelling the borderlands, working to repair the damage caused by the sorcerer Lorellan. They have recently returned to Aras’ house at Tavas Sen for a while.

title: Regarding the borderlands
author: oldernowiser
summary:
Now, regarding the borderlands. Resentment here runs high. If the Ugaro are willing to work with you, that’s extraordinarily useful. If our people here are afraid of you, that is not. You’ll have to handle it, Aras.
Tuyo, Chapter 33

title: Building bridges
author: oldernowiser
summary:
“We think it is important to be polite,” Rio inGara, Tuyo, chapter 15

The inKera tribe suffered badly during the fighting, as did the Lau across the river. But there was a time when things were much easier between the two peoples.

title: Return to Tavas Sen
author: oldernowiser
summary: Aras returns from a difficult visit to the county of Lorellan.

title: Another Tuyo
author: oldernowiser
summary:
Canon-divergent "what-if" story.

What if Aras had not been present when the inGara left the tuyo, so no-one understood the tuyo custom?

What if it had been Garoyo who sacrificed himself, an older warrior with more experience and judgement than Ryo, but one who does not speak darau? And who better than Nikoles to act as interpreter?

There is some discussion of canon-typical violence, but nothing on page.

title: The White Pheasant
author: banana_scale
summary: After the events of Tasmakat, Elaro and Ryo are sent on a quest to hunt the white-ringed pheasant for Darra and their children. The journey is long and perilous, and the two men become a lot closer than they were before.

title: equilateral
author: mage-pie (looselipssinksubs)
summary: Ryo and Elaro, a few years on from TASMAKAT. Elaro has a difficult responsibility; Ryo looks after him.

title: Navigating the borderlands
author: oldernowiser
summary:
Some months after the end of Tuyo

In the year following Lorellan’s death, Lord Aras had ridden from one borderlands town to another, partly to put an end to every kind of dishonorable behavior and stupidity he found, partly to settle problems between his people and Ugaro people, but mostly to seek out the people Lorellan had hurt in his mad ambition to rule, helping those people come to a better balance in their minds and hearts.
Tasmakat, chapter 15

What was Ryo's role in all this?

title: Convocation
author: oldernowiser
summary: Darra explains how she first met Ryo.

title: A short curse
author: oldernowiser
summary:
This follows on from the “No Offence” fic https://archiveofourown.org/works/53290528/chapters/134862298#workskin
but there’s no need to have read it first.

title: Oblation
author: Quasar
summary: Missing scenes and alternate POVs on the events of "Tuyo."

title: Etta among the Lau
author: oldernowiser
summary:
After the arrival of the fake courier message supposedly from Soretes, Aras sends Esau and Ates to Lucas Samaura in the western borderlands, recalling him and his troops to Tavas Sen.

Weeks later, before the final battle, Aras gives Etta a false memory and sends her and Garoyo to Samaura at Tavas Sen. Lucas puts them in Esau’s care.

“The little girl had a lot to say.” (Tuyo, Ch. 14)

title: At the Cry of the Eagle
author: calicoconundrum
summary: A very young Ryo meets Aras

title: The Other Tuyo
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
Arayo’s thoughts on becoming the other tuyo from the first night he became tuyo until just after he arrives at the inGara camp in the far north.

Begins immediately after events in chapter 32 of Tuyo, where Arayo inKera is offered as tuyo to Sinowa inGara.

“Arayo said softly, “My father turned his back on me.”

From Tano, chapter 9.

title: Ryo the Poet?
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
A young Ryo meets Aras

The violence tag refers to nongraphic death of an animal

title: Suelani
author: calicoconundrum
summary: Suelani, a young Lau woman, flees an iron mine in the winter country and encounters inGeiro warriors who help her.

title: The Abduction of Aras
author: calicoconundrum
summary: Ryo and other inGara abduct Aras and take him to meet Koro to discuss the problems on the border.

title: Lord Kasurat’s Tuyo
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
Ryo inGara is left as tuyo by Garoyo. Lord Kasurat accepts him as tuyo and begins to give him a tuyo’s death by torture, but Aras soon intervenes. Ryo gradually forms friendships and develops mutual respect between himself and Aras, Geras, Esau and Suyet. There are problems along the border, a sorcerer is involved, but it is not Lorellan.

POV is Ryo’s

title: Ryo the Envoy
author: calicoconundrum
summary: Ryo returns with Lord Aras to Tavas Sen. He is unsurprised that all the Lau are angry at his role in abducting Aras. But he slowly forms bonds with the guards Aras sets to protect him, and they all work together to defeat Lorellan.

title: Ryo Caught Raiding
author: calicoconundrum
summary: Ryo offers himself as Tuyo to Lord Aras after being caught in a raid.

title: Selili in the Winter Country
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
In the final chapter of Tasmakat, Ryo suggests that Aras bring both Selili and Tathimi into the winter country. Aras agrees.

This is just a bit of fluff, showing from Ryo’s POV a moment from that time when Aras, Selili, and Tathimi all visited the winter country.

title: An Ugaro with a Short Curse
author: calicoconundrum
summary: Sayetta inKorgaro flees with her daughter to Lord Aras in Tavas Sen. She fears her daughter may be a sorcerer, and feels he may be able to help.

title: Ryo, a Tiger, and Aras
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
Ryo first encounters a hungry tiger, and then he meets Aras.

This is canon divergent, so Aras has been sent to the border during the first year problems began to occur along the border, not in the fourth year.

title: Invocation and Song
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
Aras is sent to the borderlands due to Lord Kasurat’s complaints of raiding by Ugaro. He takes a number of Ugaro prisoner, one of whom, Ryo inGara offers himself as tuyo. The problem is not Lorellan this time. Aras finds himself in the winter country for part of this story.

We visit at least briefly with a number of my favorite characters.

Story is told in alternate POVs between Aras, Ryo, and Geras

title: The Weight of the Sun
author: banana_scale
summary: Rihasi, Taor, Esau, and Keraunani are asked by Lord Aras to look into the fact that no women have been admitted to the University of Avaras's mathematics program in the past two years. Rihasi must use her ability to play different roles, her mathematical abilities, her finance knowledge, and her bravery in order to succeed.

title: Secrets and Sorcery
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
In this continuation of the story begun in Invocation and Song, Ryo returns to Tavas Sen and begins his travels in the borderlands with Aras. Along the way, he learns Aras’ secret and they encounter a threat to the safety of the winter country.

POVs alternate with Ryo as primary, but with Esau, Geras and Aras POVs included as well.

title: No Longer a Tuyo
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
This is set at least six months or so after the end of Tasmakat.

Sinowa inGara tells Arayo inKera that there is no need for a tuyo any longer between inGara and inKera. Arayo is welcome to remain with the inGara or return to inKera.
What will he choose?

Like the fic The Other Tuyo, this is largely an introspective piece.

title: Aaron inGeiro
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
Tomas Todaros came to the borderlands looking for his uncle, Aaron Todaros, only to find he had died. His uncle’s wife, Suelani, was living among the Ugaro with their young son, Aaron, Tomas’ only known male living relative, and thus his heir.

Aaron reluctantly visits his Lau cousin each year to work in the family business. He dreads these visits, and does not feel close to his Lau relatives.

But a time comes when they need his help, and he answers that call. When he does, he eventually discovers that some women are far more active in deciding their own fates than he thought possible among Lau.

title: Kanes Sen
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
Ryo is visiting his inTemara cousins when he is taken up by the Lau of Kanes Sen in revenge for the deaths of Lau.

Fortunately, Lord Aras arrives just in time, but the events at Kanes Sen have a significant impact on Ryo’s life.

Years later, Aras and Ryo meet again, and the memory of what happened at Kanes Sen affects Ryo’s actions in a significant way.

This will be part of a series where Ryo and Aras meet twice in the telling, with the first meeting affecting how the second unfolds, especially with regard to the development of trust.

There are significant references to events in the book “Nikoles.” However, there are many differences here in how events unfold from canon due to Ryo’s inclusion with the inTemara being pilloried and Aras’ more timely arrival. In other words there are some spoilers for “Nikoles,” but not many more than if you read the account in “Tuyo,” given this is an alternate version with substantial differences.

title: The Boy in the Library
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
Aras and Ryo first meet when a twelve-winters Ryo attempts a daring gentle raid.

Years later, they meet again under far different circumstances.

title: Singers and Sorcerers
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
This carries on the story begun in Invocation and Song that was continued in Secrets and Sorcery. It is part three of the series Warrior and Sorcerer.

This story begins the morning after the battle with the Lau sorcerer at the inKera mine. As it opens, Ryo and Aras learn whether Soro and the other inKera suspect Aras of using sorcery to defeat the sorcerer, and if so, how they choose to respond. The answer will take them into inGeiro territory and a new threat arising from the Ugaro of the far north, the quarrelsome tribes that look to no king.

title: Messenger (Part 1)
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
In part one of a two-part fic, we meet Ryo just after he has been rescued by Aras and his men from Kasurat’s guards. Ryo has been tortured and deprived of food and water. There is no detailed description of what he suffered.

Part one sees Ryo recover and eventually recall that he had been sent as messenger to Aras with an urgent and critical message from Koro inKarano.

Ryo gradually begins to gain some trust in his rescuers.

Main POV is that of Ryo

Part two will see Aras and Ryo confront the problem that was the subject of the message he brought.

title: Prisoner
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
While in Tavas Sen, Aras discovers an Ugaro boy, Ryo, was sent to him as a messenger but taken prisoner by Kasurat’s guard. Once Aras hears the message, he deals with the problem.

Primary point of view is that of Aras.

The message Ryo brought is not the same as in ‘Messenger.’
There are similarities to ‘Messenger,’ but this is a different story.

title: Darra’s Youngest Son
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
This is a bit of fluff. Darra is concerned after her youngest son, intent on becoming a great warrior like Ryo, realizes the import of the tint of red in his hair and is upset.

 

This is canon divergent in the sense that it is set post-canon. While there is nothing inconsistent with canon as I understand it, it does concern a child born after canon.

title: Messenger (Part 2): Judgment
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
Accompanied by his great uncle, Tagaro, Ryo returns to Tavas Sen with additional messages concerning the Lau sorcerer and the enthralled Ugaro army.

Ryo and Tagaro serve as messengers to help coordinate between Lau and Ugaro as they confront this threat.

POV opens with Geras but primarily is Ryo’s POV

title: Across the River (Part 1)
author: calicoconundrum
summary: A very young Ryo and Etta are saved by Lord Gaur’s men when their camp is attacked.

title: Across the River (Part 2)
author: calicoconundrum
summary: It is ten years after the attack on the inGara camp. Relations between the inGara and the Lau of Kasurat county remain somewhat uneasy. Still, Lord Aras is forced to escape attack by fleeing to the winter country.

title: The Falling Cold
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
Ryo and Keyova inGara fall into the hands of two Lau lords near Sukarana county. Fortunately, one of them is Aras.

Ryo makes two very different decisions here than he did in canon. Those decisions initially affect also his relationship with Aras, Geras, etc.

title: The Eagle Returns (Sequel to Cry of the Eagle)
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
It is nine years after the events in Cry of the Eagle. The borderlands are peaceful and prosperous due, in large part, to changes Aras instituted.

Ryo is a frequent messenger to Lord Gaur and Lord Kasurat. But one day he brings troubling news regarding the behavior of a tribe far to the west. The inTasiyo, inGara’s most honorless enemy, have begun raiding the Lau.

title: Ryo, Two Sorcerers and a Singer
author: calicoconundrum
summary:
Garoyo does not offer Ryo as tuyo. Instead, he sends Ryo to warn the camp, while he hopes to draw the Lau after him.

Aras, however, follows Ryo.

title: The inTasiyo Tuyo
author: calicoconundrum
summary: After a disastrous raid in the summer country, Yaro inTasiyo leaves his twelve winters son as tuyo.

title: Zarab
author: calicoconundrum
summary: Esau is on a special assignment for Aras. Captured, he finds himself in a cell with a young Ugaro boy.

title: Hostage
author: calicoconundrum
summary: When his mother’s camp is threatened, Ryo offers himself as hostage, in accordance with Lau custom.
